japanese:
（姉妹の尋問を受けつつ、
　海洋博公園に移動した俺たちは――）
translation:
(While being questioned by the four sisters,
 we made our way to Ocean Expo Park%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（さっそく美ら海（ちゅらうみ）水族館に入館し
　大水槽の前にやってきていた）
translation:
(Immediately after entering Churaumi Aquarium,
 we came upon a large tank at the front.)

japanese: わぁぁぁ……！
translation: Waahh...!

japanese: すげぇな……。
translation: Amaaazing...

japanese: ええ、圧巻です……。
translation: Yes, it's breathtaking...

japanese: あ、ジンベエザメがこっち来た。
translation: Oh, a whale shark is coming this way.

japanese: うわぁ、すごい迫力！
translation: Wow, so impactful!

japanese: この大きさ、もう水槽じゃなくて海だよ！
translation: At this size, it's not just a tank, it's like the ocean!

japanese: 確かに大きいけど、さすがに海は言いすぎでしょ。
translation:
It certainly is big, but calling it an ocean is 
a little bit of an overstatement.

japanese:
話には聞いていたが、
本当にこんな大きさの水槽が存在するんだな。
translation:
I've heard about it,
but it's hard to believe there's a tank this big.

japanese:
驚きだよね。
私も写真では見たことあったけど、想像以上だよ。
translation:
It's really surprising.
I've seen photos, but it's beyond my imagination.

japanese: ああ、これだけで来てよかったって思える。
translation:
Ah, just seeing this
makes me feel like it was worth coming.

japanese: この中にお魚さんが何匹くらいいるんだろ？
translation: I wonder how many fish are in here?

japanese: よーし、数えてみましょう！
translation: Alrighty, let's count them!

japanese: あの、さすがに無謀では？
translation: Um, isn't that a bit reckless?

japanese:
この水槽だけでもずっと見てられそうだけど、
他にも見どころが多いわね。
translation:
Even just looking at this tank
could take up all our time,
but there are so many other things to see.

japanese:
そう、見所と言えば、
この大水槽は上からも見られるんですよ。
translation:
Yes, and as for the attractions,
we can view this large tank from above.

japanese:
上から？
それ、面白そう。
translation: From above? That sounds interesting.

japanese: あっちには深海魚の展示もあるみたいだよ。
translation:
I heard there's also
an exhibit of deep-sea fish over there.

japanese:
さっき熱帯魚の水槽があったわよね。
私、もっとじっくり見たいわ。
translation:
I want to take a closer look
at the tropical fish tank we saw earlier.

japanese:
あらら、これは例によって
見たいものがバラバラのパターン？
translation:
Oh dear, it seems like
we all want to see different things again.

japanese: なら、水族館内で自由行動ってことにするか。
translation: Then let's just wander around the aquarium on our own.

japanese:
そうですね。
後ほどここで合流しましょう。
translation:
Alright.
Then let's meet up here afterwards.

japanese: はーい！
translation: Okaaay!

japanese:
フータロー君はどうするの？
どこか行きたいとこある？
translation:
What about you, Futaro-kun?
Is there anywhere you want to go?

japanese:
実は、まだ朝の疲れが抜けてなくてな。
動き回りたい気分じゃねぇし、
このまま大水槽を見てようかと思ってる。
translation:
Honestly, I'm still feeling tired from this morning.
I don't really feel like moving around much, so I was
thinking of chilling here and watching the large tank.

japanese:
だったら、お姉さんが事前にリサーチしておいた
とっておきの場所があるから、そこに行かない？
translation:
Well, in that case,
I researched a special spot beforehand.
Why don't we go there?

japanese: とっておき？
translation: A special spot?

japanese:
やったね、こんないい席に座れるなんて。
私たち、持ってるかも？
translation:
Hooray, we got such a great spot to sit at.
We hit the jackpot, didn't we?

japanese:
大水槽の目の前か。
これは海の中にいる気分だな。
お前がとっておきなんて言う気持ちもわかるぜ。
translation:
Right in front of the large tank.
It really feels like we're underwater here.
I can understand why you call it a special spot.

japanese:
でっしょ～？
調べた時、ここに座れたら最高だなって
思ったんだけど、ホントにラッキーだよ。
translation:
I know, riiight? I thought it would be amazing
to sit here when I was doing my research.
We're really lucky to have found it.

japanese: じゃあ、とりあえず注文を済ませちゃおう。
translation: Well, let's order some food for now.

japanese: これは……時間を忘れそうだな。
translation: It feels like...I could lose track of time here.

japanese: だね、ずーっと見てられるよ。
translation: Yeah, I could watch this foreeever.

japanese:
おっ？
いま横切った群れってなんてお魚かな？
translation:
Oh? What kind of fish
was that school that just swam by?

japanese:
あれは多分、ロウニンアジじゃないか？
釣り人に人気の魚らしいぞ。
translation:
That was probably the giant trevally,
popular among anglers.

japanese:
へえ、アジなんだ。
お店で見るアジと全然違うよ？
でもアジだから美味しいのかな？
translation:
Oh, it's a type of jackfish.
It looks so different from the ones you see in the markets.
But maybe it's delicious, since it's a jackfish?

japanese:
どうなんだろうな。
食ったことがないからわからん。
translation:
I wonder.
I've never tasted it before.

japanese:
君の場合、食べたことがあったとしても
味の評価は怪しいけどね～。
translation:
Well, even if you had,
your assessment of the flavor would be questionable.

japanese: ほっとけ。
translation: Leave me alone.

japanese: 他に知ってるお魚、いる？
translation: Do you know any other types of fish?

japanese:
いなくもないが……
さすがに知らない種類のほうが多い。
translation:
Well, there are a few, but...
I don't know most kinds, to be honest.

japanese:
へー、フータロー君でも知らないのがいるんだ。
それだけ種類がいっぱいってこと？
translation:
Wow, even you don't know some of them, Futaro-kun?
Is it because there are so many different types?

japanese:
いや、そもそも魚の種類なんて詳しくねぇし。
テストに出るわけでもないからな。
translation:
No, I just don't really know much about fish species.
It's not like it's going to be on a test or anything.

japanese:
あはは、確かに。
二乃やらいはちゃんのほうが詳しかったりして。
translation:
Haha, yeah, I guess you're right.
Nino and Raiha-chan
probably know more about fish than we do.

japanese: 他にはどんなお魚が――わっ。
translation: So, what other kinds of fish%p-2;――%p; wow!

japanese: マンタが通りすぎただけで驚きすぎだろ。
translation:
You're a bit too surprised,
just because a manta ray swam by.

japanese:
びっくりするよー！
急にヌッと出てくるんだもん。
translation:
Of course I'd be surprised!
It came out of nowhere!

japanese:
この水槽、よく見ると
マンタみたいなのがちらほらいるが、
どいつも微妙に違うみたいだな。
translation:
If you look closely at this tank,
there are a few creatures that look like manta rays,
but they all seem slightly different.

japanese:
ん？　言われてみればそうだね。
ちょっとスマホで調べてみる。
translation:
Hmm? Now that you mention it, you're right.
Let me look it up on my phone real quick.

japanese:
ええっと、マンタは海の上のほうを泳いで
プランクトンを食べるんだって。
逆にエイは海底で貝とか食べてるみたい。
translation:
Let's see, apparently, mantas swim near the surface of
the ocean and eat plankton. On the other hand,
stingrays eat things like clams near the ocean floor.

japanese:
あ、外見でも見分けられるんだ。
ほら、比べた画像が出てきた。
translation:
Oh, you can tell them apart just by their appearance.
Look, a picture comparison came up.

japanese: へえ、どれどれ？
translation: Hmm? Let me see, now?

japanese: っ！

なるほど。
食い物が違うから顔周りに違いがあるんだな。
translation:
Oh, I see.
Their facial features are different
because they have different diets.

japanese: そっ、そうなんだね。
translation: I-I see.

japanese:
うん？
どうした――
translation:
Huh?
What's wrong%p-2;――

japanese: す、すまんっ！　近すぎたな！
translation: S-sorry! You got too close!

japanese: ううん、大丈夫。
translation: No, it's okay.

japanese:
……なんだろ。
こういうの……
私たち、付き合ってるんだなって感じだね。
translation:
...I was just thinking.
This sort of thing...
It's like we're together, you know?

japanese:
ま、まあな。
どうも慣れないというか……その……。
translation:
W-well, I guess.
It just feels like
I can't get used to it...or something...

japanese:
このまま、いつまでも慣れない気がする。
私のフータロー君への気持ちは、いつまでも……。
translation:
I have a feeling I'll never really get used to this.
My feelings for you, I mean...

japanese:
なんて。
ごめん、急に恥ずかしいこと言い出しちゃった。
translation:
Gosh, look at me.
Sorry, I didn't mean to get all embarrassing like that.

japanese:
よーし！
マンタとエイ、どっちが上手に
見分けられるか勝負だ！
translation:
Alrighty! Let's have a contest to see
who can tell the difference between
manta rays and stingrays better!

japanese: お、おう！　望むところだ！
translation: Y-yeah! Bring it on!

japanese:
ご注文は以上でお揃いですね。
それでは、ごゆっくりお過ごしください。
translation:
That's all for your order.
Please take your time and enjoy.

japanese: ありがとうございまーす。
translation: Thaaank you very much.

japanese: 一花のそれ、ラテアートってやつか。
translation: Ichika, is that latte art or somethin' on your drink?

japanese:
種類はわかんないけど、
ちっちゃいお魚がいっぱいで可愛い～。
こういうおもてなしって嬉しくなっちゃうよね。
translation:
I'm not sure what kinda fish,
but there are so many cute little fishies here.
It's so nice to receive this kind of hospitality.

japanese: そうだ、写真撮っとこ。
translation: Oh, I'll take a picture.

japanese: で、アップして……。
translation: And, upload it...

japanese: アップ？
translation: Upload?

japanese:
ＳＮＳにアップするんだよ。
フータロー君はまだそういうの使ったことない？
translation:
Upload it onto social media.
Have you never used it before, Futaro-kun?

japanese: 使い方がわからん。
translation: I don't know how to use it.

japanese:
えー？
私たちと連絡取るのにも便利だし、早く覚えなって。
translation:
Whaaat?
It's convenient for us to keep in touch, 
so hurry up and learn it already.

japanese:
面倒なんだよ。
それに、素人が下手に手を出すと
詐欺にあったりもするんだろ？
translation:
I just find it bothersome.
Besides, if amateurs meddle with it,
they might fall for scams, right?

japanese:
ぷっ！　あははっ！
フータロー君、それ本気で言ってる？
translation:
Pff! Ahaha!
Are you serious, Futaro-kun?

japanese: 当たり前だろ？
translation: Obviously?

japanese:
なるほどー。
君って変に慎重になる時があるよね。
めっちゃくちゃ大胆な時もあるくせにさ。
translation:
Oh, I see.
You're sometimes overly cautious,
even though you can be incredibly bold too.

japanese:
詐欺なんて気をつけてれば大丈夫だよ。
だから気軽に始めてみよう？
translation:
If you're careful, you'll be safe from scams.
So why not give it a try? No pressure.

japanese: そうなのか？
translation: You think so?

japanese: （ＳＮＳか、頑張ってみるかな）
translation: (Maybe I should give social media a shot.)

japanese:
メールでいいんじゃないか？
それで充分、やり取りできるだろ。
translation:
Can't we just text?
That should be enough for communication.

japanese:
フータロー君らしいなぁ。
もちろん、メールでも連絡は取れるけど――
translation:
That's so like you, Futaro-kun.
Of course, we can use email to stay in touch, but%p-2;――

japanese:
ＳＮＳのほうがもっとお手軽だから、
なんでもないことでも連絡しようって
思えたりするものなんだよ。
translation:
Social media is easier,
so you might feel like contacting me
just for trivial things.

japanese:
私は、フータロー君と
離れた場所にいても
他愛ないおしゃべりができたら嬉しいかな。
translation:
I'd be happy if I could have a casual chat with you,
even when we're far apart.

japanese: そう言われると……いいな。
translation: If you put it that way... Sounds good.

japanese: （ＳＮＳか、頑張ってみるかな）
translation: (Maybe I should give social media a shot.)

japanese:
まあ、そのつもりではある。
なんだかんだで便利そうだし。
translation:
Well, that's the plan.
It seems convenient in some way.

japanese:
ほほう、感心感心。
フータロー君が前向きでお姉さんは嬉しいよ。
translation:
Oh my, impressive, impressive.
It makes me happy
to see you taking initiative, Futaro-kun.

japanese: 連絡を取りやすいに越したことはないだろ。
translation:
There's nothing wrong
with making it easier to stay in touch.

japanese:
じゃあさ、使い始めたら
私と２人だけのグルチャ作ろうね。
translation:
Then, when you start using it,
let's create a group chat just for the two of us.

japanese: ぐる……？　なんだ？
translation: A group ch—? What?

japanese:
そういうのも全部、
お姉さんが手取り足取り教えたげる。
translation:
I'll explain all of that to you,
step by step.

japanese: ああ、助かる。
translation: Okay, that's a relief.

japanese: （ＳＮＳか、頑張ってみるかな）
translation: (Maybe I should give social media a shot.)

japanese: ……ふっ。
translation: ...Phew.

japanese:
（人との繋がりのためになにかを頑張る、か。
　こんな風に俺が思う日が来るなんて――）
translation:
(Giving more effort just to communicate 
 with other people, huh?
 I never thought I'd see the day%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（驚くほど変わったよな、俺。
　でもこれで、いや、これがいいんだ）
translation:
(I've changed a lot, surprisingly.
 But this is good. No, this is great.)

japanese:
よし、俺も写真を撮っておくか！
いつかＳＮＳを始めた時用にな！
translation:
All right, I'll take some photos too!
They'll come in handy when I start social media!

japanese:
お？　やる気じゃん。
君がどんなメッセージを送ってくれるのか
いまから楽しみだよ。
translation:
Oh? You're motivated.
I'm looking forward to the messages you'll send me.
